intro: Lepidagathis cristata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial with opposite, lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in whorled arrangements along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed sites.
